articles.author: Stella Qiu
articles.description: Asian shares and bonds extended a global rally on Thursday as a non-committal Federal Reserve Chair had markets double down on bets that U.S. interest rates have peaked and cuts are on the way.
articles.title: Asia shares, bonds rally as Powell feeds hopes of end to rate hikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Delta Air Lines (DAL.N) said on Wednesday it is cutting some corporate jobs to better manage costs, at a time when the industry grapples with higher fuel and labor expenses.
articles.title: Delta lays off some corporate workers to cut costs

articles.author: Valerie Insinna, Zeba Siddiqui
articles.description: Boeing (BA.N), one of the world's largest defense and space contractors, said on Wednesday it is investigating a cyber incident that impacted elements of its parts and distribution business and cooperating with a law enforcement probe into it.
articles.title: Boeing says 'cyber incident' hit parts business after ransom threat

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The U.S. on Tuesday imposed a form of sanctions on Myanma Oil and Gas Enterprise (MOGE), the U.S. Treasury Department said, but stopped short of imposing full blocking sanctions on the ruling junta's main source of foreign revenue.
articles.title: US targets Myanmar's state oil and gas enterprise with form of sanctions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) on Thursday left its base rate charged through the overnight discount window unchanged at 5.75%, tracking a move by the U.S. Federal Reserve to keep rates steady.
articles.title: Hong Kong central bank leaves interest rate unchanged, tracking Fed move

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: Walt Disney (DIS.N) on Wednesday formally began the process of buying Comcast's (CMCSA.O) one-third stake in Hulu, a deal that will give Disney full ownership of the streaming service and freedom to incorporate it into the Disney+ streaming service.
articles.title: Disney to buy remaining 33% stake in Hulu from Comcast

articles.author: Scott Murdoch, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Origin Energy's largest shareholder on Thursday said it would vote against a "best and final" A$16.40 billion ($10.55 billion) offer from a Brookfield consortium for Australia's biggest energy retailer, throwing the deal's future into doubt.
articles.title: Origin Energy shareholder rejects fresh Brookfield $10.5 bln bid, shares fall

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: More foreign nationals prepared to leave the besieged Gaza Strip on Thursday as the enclave's Hamas-run government said at least 195 Palestinians died in Israel's attacks on the Jabalia refugee camp, strikes that U.N. human rights officials said could be war crimes.
articles.title: Gaza says Israel's strikes on refugee camp kill more than 195 people

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu built his reputation as a security hawk on the back of his service in an elite special forces unit that carried out some of Israel's most daring hostage rescues.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu faces reckoning over Hamas disaster

articles.author: Howard Schneider, Michael Derby
articles.description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday as policymakers struggled to determine whether financial conditions may be tight enough already to control inflation, or whether an economy that continues to outperform expectations may need still more restraint.
articles.title: Fed keeps rates unchanged, Powell hedges on possible end of tightening campaign
